data.title: Validator: Bitwise Binary Operators
data.statement:
You are a teacher for many students, and it is boring for you to correct the exercises on binary manipulation by hand. You need to create an automatic validator to help you correct your students' work faster.
The validator takes : 
<<An operator : >>[[operation]] 
   - {{a}} : AND
   - {{x}} : XOR
   - {{L}} : Rotate Left
   - {{R}} : Rotate Right
<<Two operands : >>[[a]], [[b]]
<<A value to validate : >>[[c]]
data.constraints:
0 ≤ [[a]], [[b]], [[c]] ≤ 255
 [[a]], [[b]], [[c]] : Their binary representations are shown in 8 bits, with leading zero(s) where necessary (e.g : {{00001111}})
data.stubGenerator:
read operation:string(1)
read a:string(8)
read b:string(8)
read c:string(8)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1: >>[[operation]]
<<Line 2 : >>Binary representation of [[a]] 
<<Line 3 : >>Binary representation of [[b]] 
<<Line 4 : >>Binary representation of [[c]]
data.outputDescription:
<<A line containing [[isValid]] [[result]] separated by a space :>>
- [[isValid]] : {{true}} if [[c]] is the right result of the operation [[operation]] on the operands [[a]] and [[b]], else {{false}}
- [[result]] : The binary representation in 8 bits of the right result of the operation

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are a teacher for many students, and it is boring for you to correct the exercises on binary manipulation by hand. You need to create an automatic validator to help you correct your students' work faster.
The validator takes :
An operator : operation
- a : AND
- x : XOR
- L : Rotate Left
- R : Rotate Right
Two operands : a, b
A value to validate : c
Input
Line 1: operation
Line 2 : Binary representation of a
Line 3 : Binary representation of b
Line 4 : Binary representation of c
Output
A line containing isValid result separated by a space :
- isValid : true if c is the right result of the operation operation on the operands a and b, else false
- result : The binary representation in 8 bits of the right result of the operation
Constraints
0 ≤ a, b, c ≤ 255
a, b, c : Their binary representations are shown in 8 bits, with leading zero(s) where necessary (e.g : 00001111)
Example
Input
a
11001100
11000011
11000000
Output
true 11000000
